tasks.task: Operating a combine harvester during grain harvest
subtasks: Driving the combine to move through the crop
Monitoring grain intake and adjusting the conveyor belt
Ensuring proper grain flow into the bin

tasks.task: Managing a grain wagon during silage cutting
subtasks: Attaching the grain wagon to the harvester
Operating the wagon's unloading mechanism
Aligning the wagon with the harvester for efficient transfer
Locating the faulty component
Removing the part for repair or replacement
Reassembling the combine after repair

tasks.task: Adjusting combine settings for optimal performance
subtasks: Fine-tuning grain separation and cleaning
Regulating airflow and sieve settings
Checking screen/lint conditions and replacing if necessary
Monitoring the combine's path over the field
Avoiding obstacles or knappys (low spots)
Ensuring even coverage of the crop
Operating the combine's loading mechanism
Ensuring grain is deposited into the wagon properly
Adjusting the wagon's capacity if necessary

tasks.task: Ensuring proper storage of grain in wagon
subtasks: Leveling the grain to prevent settling
Covering the grain to protect from rain or pests
Checking for leaks or damage to the wagon

tasks.task: Feeding harvested grain into a storage bin
subtasks: Adjusting the bin's auger or elevator speed
Monitoring grain level and adjusting as needed
Closing the bin's access doors once full

tasks.task: Aligning the combine with the wagon for efficient loading
subtasks: Positioning the combine closely to the wagon
Ensuring proper orientation for gravity feed
Securing hoses or connections if applicable

tasks.task: Checking combine's grain loss and adjusting as necessary
subtasks: Observing the convergence plate and chute
Adjusting the size or position to reduce loss
Cleaning debris from the system

tasks.task: Descaling the combine's grain flow system
subtasks: Identifying blockages or buildup
Removing debris from screens or pipes
Maintaining clear pathways for grain flow

tasks.task: Checking grain quality in the wagon and bin
subtasks: Sampling the grain for moisture content and contaminants
Taking necessary steps to correct any issues
Ensuring the grain meets storage requirements

tasks.task: Maintaining proper driving speed on uneven roads
subtasks: Adjusting speed as needed to avoid sinking into soft soil
Ensuring efficient movement through the field
Avoiding excessive bounce or jarring of the machine
Identifying when the combine stops or malfunctions
Locating the issue (e.g., grain flow, hydraulics, electrical)
Attempting repairs or requesting assistance

tasks.task: Ensuring efficient grain transport from field to storage
subtasks: Coordinating with wagon operators to maintain good flow
Overseeing grain offloading at storage facility
Communicating with other farm equipment operators
